intro: Sclerostephane longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf sclerostephane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Sclerostephane longifolia is often found in coastal or mountainous regions where it thrives in full sun.
